text:
If you run Apache 1.3.26 on a Sun Solaris 2.6 server then Reverse Proxy to an 
IIS 4.0 NT server static html and images can end up with a Content-Length of 0 
in cache.  After you get either an image or static html then reload the IE 
browser with a [CTRL][Refresh button in browser] you'll get a blank page.  
Below is what I end up seeing in cache:

# more ../proxy/C/x/6/xZrRI9g60PxKHChGg2w

000000003D72EEB0 000000003D3AD072 000000003D72F234 0000000000000002 
000000003D72EEB0 000000003D72EEB0 0000000000000000
X-URL: http://fescommk505nts.fmr.com:8100/login/ecmncindex.html
Accept: */*
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept-Language: en-us
Cache-Control: no-cache
Connection: Keep-Alive
Cookie: HRPR%24LoginMode=0
Host: e501.fmr.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 4.0; T312461)

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: text/html
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Last-Modified: Sun, 21 Jul 2002 15:17:06 GMT
Server: Microsoft-IIS/4.0
Date: Mon, 02 Sep 2002 04:53:04 GMT
ETag: "08579acc930c21:794b1"
Content-Length: 0
creator: darron.wood@fmr.com
darron.wood@fmr.com
text:
Sorry, I just found that this is a duplicate of BugID 10128.  The first time I 
did a search of the Bug database I didn't find anything.  Please close this.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 10128 ***
creator: slive@apache.org
